thread.title_full: No receipts needed to estimate $2.5M payout to unions: Ont. minister | CTV News

author: The Canadian Press
title: No receipts needed to estimate $2.5M payout to unions: Ont. minister
text:
TORONTO -- Education Minister Liz Sandals says no receipts or invoices were provided to the government as it decided to pay teachers' unions $2.5 million for extra costs incurred during bargaining.
Sandals says she does know the cost of renting rooms, the cost of travel, the cost of food, and how many people were involved in bargaining, so no receipts were needed to estimate the unions' costs during the contract talks.
She says, "You don't need to see every bill when you're doing an estimate of costs."
The government agreed to pay the Ontario Secondary School Teachers Federation and the Ontario English Catholic Teachers' Association $1 million each, as well as $500,000 to the French teachers' union to compensate them for an extra long process under the Liberal government's new bargaining system.
Sandals says the circumstances will not reoccur because in the next round of bargaining the parties won't have to start from scratch, hammering out each and every clause.
The Elementary Teachers' Federation of Ontario, which has not yet reached a central contract with the government, announced today that its members will be withdrawing from all voluntary extracurricular activities as of Wednesday.
The union said the move was aimed at putting pressure on Crown negotiators to return to the table, but Sandals said Wednesday that the government has been available and ready to bargain.
The teachers were already staging a work-to-rule campaign that included no parent-teacher meetings and no class trips, but had warned they would expand it further if there was no bargaining progress.
